metadata.title: CVE-2021-43533 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When parsing internationalized domain names, high bits of the characters inthe URLs were sometimes stripped, resulting in inconsistencies that couldlead to user confusion or attacks such as phishing. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 94.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
